posts.name: Joe McLoughlin
posts.cooked:
Ok, so we’re checking our swerve modules right before states and one of the motors is spinning w/o resistance. Take the module out and the pin that keeps the pinion output shaft at a certain height has snapped clean off. All seems to be recent, we were doing fine in Finals at Macomb. The output shaft will slide to the point where the gear will not engage with the motor itself. See attached pictures. We’re swapping in our old falcons from last year, but do you guys know what it could be caused by / why we’re the only team so far? Check your motors! We think it might have gotten to all of our drive motors. Spin still seems to be fine, but still unnerving with states being tmrw.

94F2EA9A-C1CB-491A-A9A7-70B5B7D41F30 1920×2560 314 KB

94F2EA9A-C1CB-491A-A9A7-70B5B7D41F30 1920×2560 314 KB

94F2EA9A-C1CB-491A-A9A7-70B5B7D41F30 1920×2560 314 KB

Snapped pin in output shaft (only will let me upload one media per post) I will add in comments what the pin should look like and what it can slide to.

posts.name: Joe McLoughlin
posts.cooked:
D33B3996-F1DE-4756-AB5F-AAC7430747F0 1920×2560 345 KB What the shaft should be held to with the pin that has snapped

D33B3996-F1DE-4756-AB5F-AAC7430747F0 1920×2560 345 KB

D33B3996-F1DE-4756-AB5F-AAC7430747F0 1920×2560 345 KB

posts.name: Joe McLoughlin
posts.cooked:
What it slides to, leaving no connection with the actual motor itself, meaning the motor spins but the output shaft does not. 51B8C186-0070-4C9A-8655-87EB5E13AAFE 1920×2560 402 KB

@jtrv add one to the list

Good that you caught this before competitions! Hopefully you have spares, otherwise im sure there are local teams that would be willing to lend you one.

posts.name: Joe McLoughlin
posts.cooked: Yeah, at this point in time we’re switching out our one backup module, and because we haven’t seen the issue in the other ones yet we aren’t going to fix them until we drastically need to. (basically super last minute)

posts.name: Rich Wong
posts.cooked: Does anyone know if VEX/CTRE sell a replacement shaft? The ones on their site don’t seem to be the same.
